result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter S Oconnor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peter S Oconnor is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Peter S Oconnor was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Peter S Oconnor was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:   AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $1800 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Counts 1 & 4 - DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2 & 3 - Dismissed by the State.  Sentencing arguments made.  Counts 1 & 4 - Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 174 days in the KCJ forthwith and is given credit for 174 days.  Each count is concurrent.  On Count 1 court imposes a fine of $1800 plus costs and in Count 4 only costs are ordered.  DE is also ordered to pay prosecution costs in the amount of $140 and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 30 months.   AODA Assessment & Ignition Interlock is ordered.  Probation is concurrent in 15CM391 & 15CT111.  Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Atty Lassiter requests a 90 day adjournment to allow DE time to complete Living Free Program and requests a plea & sentencing date; no objection by the State.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Atty Lassiter states DE is attempting to get into the Living Free Program and requests a brief adjournment; no objection by the State.  FPT on 6/16/15 at 10:40 AM.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

1:21  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter. Clerk LE.   Plea of Not Guilty entered. PTC 4-24-15 @ 2:00 pm, FPT 5-27-15 @ 10:00 am, With other case: 15CT111.  $2000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License or w/o ignititon interlock device installed.  If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.
346.63(1)(a) OWI 3rd   /   343.44(1)(b) OAR   /   347.413(1) Failure To Install Ignition Interlock Device   /   946.49(1)(a) Misd BJ
and witness list filed by the State
